title: Antarctica
description: In January 2022 my wife and I went on our (delayed by 1.5 years) honeymoon to Antarctica with National Geographic/Lindblad Expeditions. We started from the southernmost point of Argentina and spent 2 weeks cruising around the edge of the Antarctic peninsula with a few shore excursions.

photos.description: A plane landing at the Ushuaia airport.
A glacier with layers of volcanic ash.
A leopard seal yawning on an ice floe. Taken from about 100ft away in an inflatable Zodiac, which they are apparently known to pop.
An orca and a Minke whale. This was one of two fairly large pods of orcas we saw.
Some porpoising Adélie penguins.
The antarctic continent. Taken after hiking up a hill and it was actually pretty warm with the sun out (~40°F).
A Weddell seal trying to nap.
Two Adélie penguins considering sliding down the hill.
A Gentoo penguin chick following its parent. There were thousands of these things in the colony and they smelled awful.
Adélie penguins diving into the water from an iceberg.
Two Adélie penguins chattering at each other. Taken with a very cool, very heavy 600mm telephoto lens that I was able to borrow from National Geographic for the duration of the trip.
Some Adélie penguins lining up very nicely for their portraits.
A humpback breaching out of the water. There was actually another one doing this simultaneously out of frame to the right, but I didn't get it.
An Adélie penguin demonstrating how they get up on the icebergs. They don't jump high enough and slip off pretty often.
A colony of over 1.5 million Adélies on Paulet island.
An Adélie staring me down out of the crowd.
A spy-hopping orca. This was the second pod that the crew woke us up at 3:45 AM to see.
The sun "rising" over a ridge. Since it was summer the sun never fully set below the horizon, so this blueish light is about as dark as it got.
A mountain reflected in the water.
A bunch of very picturesque sea ice. The ship had broken through it only about 20 minutes earlier, but it reforms very quickly.
A Gentoo going for a stroll.
A diving humpback's tail.
A preening Gentoo.
A Gentoo waddling towards me down one of the highways that they dig out by walking over the same path.
